author: IanKemp
body:
# Steps to reproduce

```powershell
PS> Set-Item wsman:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts -Value <ip-address>

Start WinRM Service
WinRM service is not started currently. Running this command will start the WinRM service.

Do you want to continue?
[Y] Yes  [N] No  [S] Suspend  [?] Help (default is "Y"): ^C
PS> Set-PSDebug -Strict # or Set-StrictMode -Version 1
PS> Set-Item wsman:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts -Value <ip-address>
Set-Item: The variable '$_' cannot be retrieved because it has not been set.
```

# Expected behavior

`Set-Item` executes successfully.

# Actual behavior

`Set-Item` fails as per the above excerpt.

Note that this occurs on any PowerShell version, not just Core. Tested with Core and Desktop 5.1 and the behaviour is the same.

# Environment data

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-rc.2
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-rc.2
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18363
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @PaulHigin Could you please comment the issue? Looks like "by-design" but the error message could be better.

comments.author: PaulHigin
comments.body: This behavior is by design and implemented in the wsman drive provider.  This was probably done to prevent a user of inadvertently re-starting WinRM (and terminating all current hosted sessions) when setting a drive item.

title: Set-Item with wsman virtual filesystem provider fails under strict mode
